result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance M. Arthurs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $114.50 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation. If unable to pay while on Probation may be reduced to a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
May not vote until civil rights are restored. May not hold elective office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation.
Must submit a DNA sample but no surcharge. Must complete a Compas Evaluation and Mental Health Assessment and follow through.

$1,325.90 Restitution payable through Department of Corrections while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid by the end of term the remaining amount will be reduced to a civil judgment on behalf of Mr. Lee.  

$4,332.00 Restitution re Gary Olby which is joint and several with Joseph Collins payable through Department of Corrections.  The amount that is not paid during term will be reduced to civil judgment.
